IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A CHALLENGING AND ENGAGING COLLEGE PREPARATORY PROGRAM FOR BUSY ARTISTS, ATHLETES AND OTHER YOUNG PEOPLE WHO ARE SERIOUS ABOUT THEIR STUDIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF PROFESSIONAL CHILDREN'S SCHOOL IS TO PROVIDE A CHALLENGING ACADEMIC EDUCATION FOR YOUNG PEOPLE WORKING IN OR STUDYING FOR CAREERS IN THE PERFORMING AND VISUAL ARTS, COMPETITIVE SPORTS AND OTHER ENDEAVORS; TO MEET THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF OUR STUDENTS; PROVIDE MASTERY OF FUNDAMENTAL SKILLS AND PREPARE THEM FOR COLLEGE OR OTHER POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION; TO TEACH YOUNG PEOPLE TO BALANCE THE DEMANDS OF THEIR PROFESSIONAL, PERSONAL AND ACADEMIC LIVES; TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR YOUNG PEOPLE WHO MUST OFTEN CONTEND WITH THE PRESSURES OF THE ADULT WORLD IN ADDITION TO THE NORMAL PRESSURES OF ADOLESCENCE; TO ENCOURAGE YOUNG PEOPLE TO RESPECT OTHERS OF DIVERSE ETHNIC, RACIAL, ECONOMIC, GEOGRAPHIC AND ARTISTIC BACKGROUNDS; TO BALANCE THEIR INDIVIDUAL NEEDS WITH THE NEEDS OF OTHERS AND TO ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR THEIR DECISIONS; TO FOSTER A COMMUNITY IN WHICH BOTH ACADEMIC AND ARTISTIC PURSUITS ARE VALUED.
IRS990.Desc: PROFESSIONAL CHILDREN'S SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT COEDUCATIONAL DAY SCHOOL FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 6 THROUGH 12 WHO ARE PREPARING FOR OR ARE ALREADY PURSUING CAREERS IN THE PERFORMING ARTS, ENTERTAINMENT OR COMPETITIVE SPORTS, OR WHO ARE DRAWN TO A CREATIVE ENVIRONMENT SUPPORTIVE OF THE ARTS. THE SCHOOL ENROLLS APPROXIMATELY 110 STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO GENERATE INCOME THAT CAN BE USED FOR RESTRICTED AND UNRESTRICTED OPERATIONAL EXPENDITURES.

THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE. THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO JUNE 30, 2021.
RECLASS OF BOND PURCHASE EXPENSE FROM PART VIII TO PART IX -2,065.
FINANCIAL AID RECLASSED TO PART IX, LINE 2 1,291,916. RENTAL EXPENSE RECLASS -23,976.
RECLASS OF PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING FEES RENTAL EXPENSE RECLASS 23,976.
FINANCIAL AID RECLASSED TO PART IX, LINE 2 1,291,916. RECLASS OF BOND PURCHASE EXPENSE FROM PART VIII TO PART IX 2,065.

THE SCHOOL PUBLICIZES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ALONG WITH OTHER NEW YORK CITY INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS IN THE NEW YORK TIMES ON A YEARLY BASIS AS WELL ON ALL PRINT ADS. IN ADDITION, THE SCHOOL DISCLOSES THE NON DISCRIMINATION POLICY ON THE HOMEPAGE OF ITS WEBSITE - HTTPS://WWW.PCS-NYC.ORG/
STATE AID: $126,211 INCLUDED IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: RECEIVED FINANCIAL AID TO ATTEND PCS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL GRANTS FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. THE AWARDED FINANCIAL AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION, AND THIS IS TRACKED BY THE ADMISSIONS AND BUSINESS OFFICE. STUDENTS SEEKING AID ARE REQUIRED TO APPLY THROUGH A THIRD-PARTY SCHOOL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, TADS. WHEN A FAMILY APPROACHES THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS REQUESTING FINANCIAL AID, THE FAMILY IS DIRECTED TO SET UP AN ACCOUNT ON TADS. TADS THEN TRACKS WHEN ALL REQUESTED FA DOCUMENTATION SUBMITTED, INCLUDING: - APPLICATION (REQUIRED) - FAMILY TAX FILINGS FOR THE PREVIOUS YEAR (REQUIRED) - W2S, 1099S OR OTHER FORMS REFLECTING INCOME EARNED (REQUIRED) - A LETTER WITH ADDITIONAL NEED INFORMATION (NOT REQUIRED) ONCE THE INFORMATION IS ENTERED, TADS THEN PROVIDES AN ASSESSMENT OF A FAMILY'S FINANCIAL SITUATION AND ESTIMATES WHAT A FAMILY COULD PAY TOWARDS TUITION. THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE (FAC) IS PROVIDED A BUDGET AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF TOTAL FINANCIAL AID THAT CAN BE DISTRIBUTED FOR THE FISCAL YEAR. THERE ARE ALSO ADDITIONAL FUNDS AVAILABLE FROM TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS, WHICH CAN BE APPLIED BEYOND THE BUDGET, IF NEEDED. WITH THIS INFORMATION, THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS CALLS TOGETHER THE FAC (WHICH INCLUDES THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, AND OTHER SENIOR ADMINISTRATORS). THE FAC MEET, DURING THE PEAK OF ADMISSIONS SEASON (BETWEEN JANUARY-JUNE), ON A WEEKLY BASIS, TO REVIEW FAMILY FILES AND DETERMINE THE FA AWARD BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND WITHIN THE FISCAL YEAR BUDGET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE A, COLUMN F:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REFINANCING OF PRIOR NYC IDA BOND, FINANCING OF THE RENOVATION AND REPLACEMENT OF CERTAIN EXTERIOR WINDOWS AT THE FACILITY, PAYMENT OF ANY REDEMPTION PREMIUM, AND PAYMENT OF CERTAIN ISSUANCE COSTS.

AS PROVIDED IN TREASURY REGULATION SECTION 1.1414( C)(2)(I)(B) THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE PAYMENTS TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT UNDER THE PRIVATE PAYMENT TEST MAY NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE BUSINESS USE AND/OR UNRELATED TRADE OR BUSINESS USE. ACCORDINGLY, THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE PAYMENTS FOR THE REPORTING PERIOD DOES NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT STATED IN PART III, LINE 6. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT UNDERTAKEN AN ANALYSIS OF THE PRIVATE SECURITY TEST WITH RESPECT TO THE BONDS, AS THE LEVEL OF PRIVATE BUSINESS USE AND/OR UNRELATED TRADE OR BUSINESS REPORTED IN PART III, LINE 6, IS NOT IN EXCESS OF THE AMOUNTS PERMITTED UNDER SECTION 145 OF THE CODE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ITS FORM 990 PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND HAS ESTABLISHED THE FOLLOWING REVIEW PROCESS TO ENSURE THAT THE INFORMATION REPORTED IS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE. WHEN THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN PREPARED, REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND IS READY TO BE FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, A PUBLIC DISCLOSURE COPY IS ELECTRONICALLY SENT TO THE BOARD MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION FOR ANY COMMENTS. ANY COMMENTS ARE THEN GROUPED, SUMMARIZED AND PROVIDED TO THE OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS. EACH ISSUE IS DOCUMENTED AND ADDRESSED UNTIL THE RETURN IS FINALIZED AND APPROVED FOR FILING. A FULL COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS ALSO MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY TRUSTEE WISHING TO VIEW THE FULL RETURN INCLUDING SCHEDULE B INFORMATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL CURRENTLY HAS IN PLACE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, WHICH THE BOARD ANNUALLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES. THE BOARD MANDATES EACH TRUSTEE, OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE (IF ANY) OF THE SCHOOL TO ANNUALLY SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS THAT MAY EXIST. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, AN INTERESTED PERSON DISCLOSES THE EXISTENCE OF THE INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE TRUSTEES AND MEMBERS OF THE COMMITTEES CONSIDERING THE PROSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE INTEREST AND ALL OTHER MATERIAL FACTS, AND AFTER ANY DISCUSSION WITH THE INTERESTED PERSON, THE INTERESTED PERSON IS NOT TO BE PRESENT AT ANY POINT WHILE THE DETERMINATION OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCUSSED AND VOTED UPON BY REMAINING THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS. THE MINUTES OF THE MEETINGS OF THE BOARD AND ITS COMMITTEES WILL REFLECT THE BOARD'S DELIBERATIONS AND VOTING PROCESS ON THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS SET BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL USING ANNUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATION AND COMPARABLE DATA. THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD GATHERS PEER INSTITUTION COMPENSATION DATA FROM AT LEAST TWO SOURCES, ALWAYS INCLUDING NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NAIS) AND NYS ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (NYSAIS) FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND PROVIDES THE DATA TO THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION FOR REVIEW. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE USES THE INFORMATION PROVIDED TO DETERMINE THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S SALARY AND BENEFIT AND SUBMIT THE RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR FINAL APPROVAL. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN MARCH 2023 AND DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE BOARD MEETINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FORM 990 IS POSTED ON GUIDESTAR.ORG AND OTHER SIMILAR TYPES OF WEBSITES. IN ADDITION, THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, A COPY OF THE FORM 990, AND BY-LAWS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST OR BY CALLING THE ORGANIZATION DIRECTLY.
